alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Hamilton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:04PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Bradley and southeastern Hamilton Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 503 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Harrison, or near Chattanooga, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Lakesite, Ridgeside, Harrison, Red Bank, Collegedale, East Brainerd, Red Clay State Park, Harrison Bay State Park and East Ridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
